Order if Group B Strep positive (positive culture, Group B Strep bacteriuria in current pregnancy, prior neonate with Group B Strep disease)
If Group B Strep status unknown, order only if risk factors present (less than 37 weeks of gestation, membrane rupture 18 hours or more, fever, prior neonate with Group B Strep disease)
2.5 million_unit, IV, q4h, order duration: 7 day

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
2,000 mg, IV, once, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated and if organism is susceptible to clindamycin
900 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated and organism susceptibilities unknown
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 7 day

10 unit, IM, once, drug form: inj
5 unit, IV, once, drug form: inj

For prevention of postpartum hemorrhage in vaginal deliveries for patients with more than 1 risk factor, to reduce the need for uterine massage:  - History of PPH or retained placenta  - Grand multiparity (more than 5)  - Uterine over distension related to multiple gestation, fetal macrosomia (fundal height over 40 cm or clinical/ultrasound estimated fetal weight more than 4000 g) or polyhydramnios (one or more amniotic fluid pockets over 10 cm)  - Chorioamnionitis  - Antepartum hemorrhage (vaginal bleeding requiring medical care after 20 weeks gestational age)  - Induction or augmentation of labour with oxytocin for at least 4 hours  - Prolonged labour (active phase more than 12 hours)  - Rapid-excessive labour (cervical dilatation of 10 cm/h or more)
100 mcg, IM, once, drug form: inj

Nurse to NOT DISCONTINUE this phase please
For all Rh negative OR Rh unknown women
Collect Cord Blood Sample at Delivery and Place Order for Rh Testing
Collect cord blood sample at delivery and place order for “RBC Neonatal Investigation” in newborn chart
Nurse to Order Lab Collection of Maternal Blood for RhIg Eligibility Testing
Nurse to place order for “RBC Maternal Investigation” in maternal chart for RhIG Eligibility, at least one hour after delivery of placenta
If patient is eligible for RhIG (as per laboratory comment for maternal investigation), then order and then administer 1500 IU (300 ug), Routine, IM, Administer over: Not Applicable, T;N
